statements: UPDATE transaction_records SET amount = 1000.50, description = 'Payment Received' WHERE transaction_id = 123456
UPDATE transaction_records SET user_id = 98765, transaction_date = '2022-01-15 09:30:00' WHERE transaction_id = 654321
UPDATE transaction_records SET amount = 500.00, description = 'Updated amount to 500' WHERE transaction_id = 123;
UPDATE transaction_records SET user_id = 456, transaction_date = NOW(), description = 'Changed user and updated date' WHERE user_id = 789;
UPDATE transactions SET amount = 1000 WHERE transaction_id = 1;
UPDATE audit_logs SET action = 'Approved', log_date = '2022-07-15 10:30:00' WHERE log_id = 5;
UPDATE transactions SET amount = 1000.50, description = 'Payment received' WHERE transaction_id = 12345;
UPDATE audit_logs SET action = 'Transaction Updated', user_id = 6789, log_date = '2022-01-15 09:30:00' WHERE log_id = 54321;
UPDATE transactions SET transaction_amount = 5000.00 WHERE transaction_id = 101;
UPDATE accounts SET account_balance = 15000.50, account_name = 'Savings Account' WHERE account_id = 201;
UPDATE transactions SET transaction_amount = 500.75, transaction_date = '2023-09-15' WHERE transaction_id = 1001;
UPDATE accounts SET account_balance = account_balance - 1000.50 WHERE account_id = 2001;
UPDATE transactions SET amount = amount + 100 WHERE transaction_id = 12345;
UPDATE accounts SET account_balance = account_balance - 50 WHERE account_id = 54321;
UPDATE transactions SET amount = 500.00, transaction_date = '2022-01-15' WHERE transaction_id = 101;
UPDATE audit_logs SET action_taken = 'Transaction Updated', log_timestamp = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP WHERE log_id = 201;
UPDATE transactions SET amount = 100.5, description = 'Payment for services' WHERE transaction_id = 12345;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = 5000.75, account_name = 'Savings Account' WHERE account_id = 98765;
UPDATE transactions SET amount = 100.50, description = 'Updated transaction details' WHERE transaction_id = 123;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance - 50 WHERE account_name = 'Savings';
